Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne Thanks for your response. My mom goes to see her surgeon this Monday. I'm just nervous and scared...so thank you again for responding. Kathleen
Posts.Title: Recurrent Breast Cancer Question

Posts.Content: Hi there. I'm just wondering if you received an response on this. My mom was diagnosed last November with breast cancer and after a seemingly easy go around with the treatment and surgeries she was told by two of her surgeons that she was going to be fine. Now, 6 months later she's discovered a lump and after seeing one of her surgeons yesterday they are almost positive it's cancer. The lump is in the same breast and just above the scar from the original surgery. Anyone have any info or ideas on this or why it happens?
Posts.Title: Recurrent Breast Cancer Question

Posts.Content: Hi Laurasue Thank you for your post and for sharing your experience. I appareciate it. My mom goes to see her surgeon today for basically a pre-op appointment. We'll hopefully know more this afternoon. I appreciate everyone's responses and thoughts...thank you so much. Kathleen
Posts.Title: Recurrent Breast Cancer Question

Posts.Content: Hi Jill Thank you for your post...at this stage of the game my mom's surgeon is 99% positive the lump is scar tissue. My mom is going in next week on an out-patient basis to have the lump removed and sent off for a biopsy. Now, there is always still a chance...but for now we are very hopeful. Thanks to everyone for your kind words and support. Kathleen
Posts.Title: Recurrent Breast Cancer Question
